I contacted AT&T via phone on 1/29/24 regarding a notice in my account that I could return my device and waive any remaining installment balance. It stated I had until July 31, 2024, to do this. I advised the representative that I planned to cancel my service and switch to another provider. The representative stated that the offer in my account was not valid and that AT&T does not allow returning a device past 30 days. I had the iPhone since 4/6/2022, so AT&T was aware that I had the phone in my possession for over 30 days. He did not attempt to provide any further information or keep my business. He also did not advise me that if I did not cancel before the start of my next billing cycle (which ended several days later) I would be charged an entire month of service. I previously had AT&T internet in addition to my wireless service and was only billed for the days/service used. I assumed this was the same for the wireless service. On 2/6/24, I ported my service from AT&T to another carrier. I am now being charged an entire month of service when once again, I canceled only 3 days after my billing cycle started and was never informed of this when I spoke to the representative on 1/29/24. Due to the false advertisement of being able to turn in my financed device at the current time, misinformation, and lack of quality cell phone service received from my time with AT&T, I am demanding my final bill be waived and my account settled as paid in full.3/2024 update - I was contacted by the company president who made things right. She was friendly, knowledgeable, and truly cared.

I gave them my four digest code, said It didn‚Äôt work. I know it‚Äôs correct. Having difficulty understanding the person. After well over an hour I was told I needed to go to the store. I immediately went to the store in Raynham MA.  I met with the store manager Tyler Coward. He immediately assisted me. TookThe time to solve my dilemma. Found out they sent my first payment to the wrong account. My code was correct. Paid the correct amount, will be receiving a refund and am getting my emails. Tyler was awesome. Adam King, My man.For some context - I am moving and was shopping for internet for my new address. As I was browsing the website, I got a call from an number not trackable via google search.The rep said they were from AT&T and started asking for personal info such as my full name, number, home address and it was concerning from my perspective - getting a call from random number stating they are from AT&T asking for personal information after I tried to look up the number and didn't find anything.Dumb me, I gave it to them - and as soon as I did and they confirmed my address the line disconnects.I was worried and was thinking did I just get scammed?I called the phone number on the website and my man Adam King answers the phone. I called for two reasons - one, wanting to get service for a new address and two, talk about a call i just received asking for my personal info.I told Adam about what the conversation sounded like and we confirmed that it was indeed an actual AT&T Rep.but not only did we confirm the conversation I had with the unknown caller - he gave me a bunch of tips on how I can confirm with the caller to prove it's a legit person and also gave really good info on what scammers can do with certain information and assured me and said that good thing I didn't give more than just my address.I was so worried that I just got scammed and Adam gave me really good assurance.I'm just ranting at this point and i'm not really sure how to explain or talk about my gratitude and the way Adam handled my situation.HE IS THE BEST!This man was so informative and I'm so happy I got him as the person who answered my call.He went above and beyond to try and help me.@AT&T, please listen to the recorded conversation.He is amazing.We need more reps like him.

I've been a longtime & faithful customer of AT&T for over 25 years. I have endured many unpleasant customer service reps over the years. After reaching my breaking point, with trade in issues, lost/stolen devices, bait & switches, & fraud, by Corporate AT&T Stores, I'd had enough. I called in on Wednesdays July 26th, to cancel my services & move all of my many lines to Verizon, despite the costs. When i called in I was already irritated from dealing with past insufficient reps, that had the empathy & customer service of a robot. I was greeted by "AMBER FULLER" in the customer loyalty department.  Immediately she greeted me with a true dedicated desire to help me, I had no idea what was in store for me! She quickly broke my walls of irritation down, & let me know that she was there to help & wouldn't get off of the phone until she resolved all of my problems, that she could clearly see were tons! When I tell you, she dove into the accounts in true shock, to realize everything I was stating was true, she was in disbelief, & Immediately started reaching out to managers of higher power, & to ensure that I was given a true resolution! She even got my number, & gave me her ID number & credentials to follow-up with me, to make sure all of my issues were resolved (we've all heard this before, right). Of course there were limitations on what she could do, but she put me in touch with those without limits. The very next day I was given a call by The President's Office, followed by an email with their contact info. Being in meetings I could not answer. Before I could even call back the next day, I received another call, & was able to answer this time it was "April Witson" from the President's office, she greeted me, & without me having to explain, plead my case, or beg for what was rightfully owed to me, 16 months in the making, for this incident. This is all because of the impeccable ground work done & notes done taken by "AMBER FULLER".April began to tell me, what was done to make me whole. An immediate retroactive credit was given that was applied immediately, no more waits, or fake business days, as i was told previously!!! "AMBER FULLER" even followed up as she promised she would. When I say my faith has been restored into AT&T, because of AMBER showing true empathy, genuine care, & loyalty: a repeated hellacious upgrade experience, will be no more! After 16 months of being wronged in this instance, because of "AMBER" I was finally made whole. For all of my AT&T needs going further I will always TRUST AMBER to get it done!!! AT&T honestly needs to reward her, & she truly needs to be a Customer Loyalty Training Manager. Because she truly exemplifies what a TRUE CUSTOMER LOYALTY REPRESENTATIVE IS SUPPOSED TO BE. "Hats off to "AMBER FULLER' for truly being the best part of AT&T.

I am an AT&T customer over twenty years. Over the years I have experienced the good the bad and the very bad! However on January 4, I went into the Plantation Sunrise store to upgrade my phone. My purse had been stolen a week before and I needed a new phone. I went the night before after 6:00pm. I was helped but it felt half- hearted that evening by the store associates. I left feeling extremely disappointed. They seemed uninterested in helping me and passed me along to two other associates. No one seemed to be tuned into what I needed and almost felt like I was left hanging. Half - hearted, no smiles and poor customer service. HOWEVER the next day I went back to give it another try and upgrade my phone ‚Ä¶ and by the luck of the draw, I got Carlos M! As the song goes, ‚Äú what a difference a day makes.‚Äù Carlos was smiling, happy to help me, took time with me to explain things and made me feel like an important customer who has been a loyal customer over twenty years. I felt valued and left with a smile and feeling great with my iPhone 15 upgrade!  I am not tech savvy and asked Carlos what he would want his mom to have. He said, ‚Äú my mom has a iPhone 15 and it‚Äôs a great phone! Me being a photographer, Carlos said I will love the camera quality. He set my phone up and showed me what I needed to do! This IS the kind of associate / employee you want to have working for you!! He was efficient, stayed focused and I felt sincerely tuned into and he was helping me. Maybe people have worked there for too long and need a break or a refresher course in customer service. Maybe the associates have forgotten how to look at customers and smile and look them in the face. Maybe it‚Äôs just become a boring, get my pay check and go job!  This plantation location on Sunrise  is my store that I go into for all my AT&T needs. I pay my phone bill there and browse the store looking for new products.  I am a business owner and have spend thousands and thousands of dollars with your company. Carlos saved me from ultimately having an unhappy experience and he saved AT&T from loosing a great customer. I hope he is recognized and valued with your company. He sure is with me! I thought you might like to hear positive feedback about a great employee!

I went to my local AT&T store (in north Winston-Salem, NC) a couple of nights ago, anticipating that I would be switching cell phone carriers.  Instead, my customer service agent Shady (yes, ironically, that was his name) listened to everything I had to say and ultimately advised me to buy a new cell phone elsewhere.  He understood that I am retired, living on a fixed income and unwilling and unable to pay $500 to $1000 for a phone.  Nor did I need to overload on gigabytes.  I use my phone for calls and texts and minimally for on-line searches.  Shady did not attempt to sell me any more than what I was asking for.  When I complimented him, he simply said, "I try to give customers what they want."  WHAT A CONCEPT!  I was impressed, went on line and purchased a refurbished phone and will continue as a loyal AT&T customer.  I have been with them for close to 20 years, after dumping Verizon for constantly bombarding me with "offers" to increase my bill.  Excellent customer service DOES still exist.  Thank you, Shady, for restoring my faith!

Cody at the Bluemound Rd. Waukesha, Wisconsin store provided amazing customer service for my mother, today. We recently switched from Verizon to AT &T.  To date, most of our experience has not been positive.The transition has required a lot of hours between my son first making the switch, to bringing me and my other son and parents onto AT & T.  It seems either the sales people in Stuart, Florida (where my son and I live) didn‚Äôt set things up properly (after hours of us spending time with them in the store) or the transfer process is not properly communicated to all AT & T staff.  Not only did my son (who is the account holder) spend 8+ hours between the Stuart store and corporate (on the phone) setting up his service and straightening out charges to his account, but my other son and I spent 3+ hours at the Stuart store only to spend another 2 hours on the phone the next day finding out the ‚Äúporting‚Äù didn‚Äôt work properly; then my mom (in Wisconsin) had several difficulties setting up my dad‚Äôs new phone that we bought in Stuart and had shipped to him in Wisconsin.Our phone charges are a mess; very difficult to determine if we were ultimately charged appropriately (we‚Äôre still trying to figure it out).Now today, my mom (who is the only one who kept her ‚Äúnew‚Äù phone purchased thru Verizon before knowing we would be transitioning service to AT&T) all of a sudden could not make calls or receive calls.  I tried (from Florida) to help her figure out the problem, but had no luck.  We called her Waukesha store and Cody took our call.  He offered a solution that wouldn‚Äôt work for my mom.   He told my mom he could definitely help her with her SIM failure if she came to the store; which she did.  Cody found the problem and fixed it within minutes!I called to personally thank Cody.  I explained to him that my parents no longer have a landline phone, so they rely on their cell phones.  My dad‚Äôs health is very poor and he is not very mobile.  So, when he needs my mom‚Äôs assistance, he HAS to be able to reach her.  Today, he needed my mom and she was at the store running errands.  He couldn‚Äôt reach her by phone, so he texted ‚ÄúHELP!‚Äù  Imagine how scary that was for them both?  It is imperative that my parents have reliable phones and phone service.Cody‚Äôs assistance today was extremely valuable.  I hope his manager and superiors see this post.  There is definitely room for improvement for the company to make the transition process from another cell phone service to AT & T a more seamless and less time consuming one.  The consumer‚Äôs time is just as valuable as the company‚Äôs time.Cody, thank you, again, for restoring my mom‚Äôs ability to make and receive calls.  You are much appreciated!

On Dec. 25th my service went down right in the middle of a Lyft ride!  The bomb that blew up in Nashville caused the shut down of ALL AT&T services.  I was in a panic the next day because I needed to make money to pay my bills & rent!!  I went to the S. Church St. location & found out from Julian, Retail Sales Consultant what happened.  He explained everything to me as several other costumers were coming in to the store angry wanting to cancel!  It was such a horrible disaster!  I stayed calm, listened to other costumers complaints/issues and decided to go to Wal-Mart to buy a Straight Talk phone so I could get driving for Lyft & Uber.  Well, now the real drama begins for me! After the craziness @ Wal-Mart with all the AT&T customers buying all their phones, waiting in line for hours & trying to get my Lyft & Uber accounts on my new phone, I decided to go back to Julian @ AT&T for help.  I brought my laptop & new Straight Talk phone to seek help.  I connected to the WIFI next door @ Dunkin Donuts and attempted to get my new phone number connected to my Lyft & Uber accounts.  After the hours of endless drama that ended around 3pm, I was able to get on the road driving for Lyft & Uber to make money!  This whole process began at 10am @ the AT&T store and ended their @3pm!!  Thanks to Julian helping me figure this out, I made enough money to cover my rent!  I will forever be grateful for the service & help that he gave me that day!

It has been quite some time since we have had BAD static on our 3 landline phones, even though we have cell phones as well.  I keep the landline phone because of hearing problems, and I have a machine that gives details when someone calls in to help, as well.  The static on our phone has been bad for 6 months or longer, and even people leaving messages on the landline phone, we could hear nothing of what they were saying, or even to call out on the phones. I decided after all this time that I have been paying the AT&T bill, we needed to find out why there was so much static on our phone all the time.  I made the call today, and within 30 minutes, Craig McMillin (I ask his name, but I'm not for sure of the correct spelling of the last name, but I believe he has worked for the company for several years) arrived, (I also received a text that he was on his way and the time period) after calling and confirming the correct address of where we lived. When arriving he told me his name and who he was with.  After telling him that we were having BAD static on all 3 landline phones, he went to each phone to check them out, etc. Then he run test on them. Even though he left some of them unplugged, he told me before he left, he would put everything back the way it was.  After checking the 3 landline phones, he could not find any problem, but the static was still there.  He checked outside of the house, and could see that the wires were leading to our "craw space" basement.  I really hated to have him look there, (we have had a lot of water in this area because of all the rain, and we have been trying to drain it out) but he told me he was checking "every" area, to try to "pinpoint" where the problem was.  To make the long story short, he FOUND the problem in our craw space, and was able to FIX the problem.  Craig was very personal and nice, and I would recommend him checking out anyone's problem, as he is very thorough!

Review AT&T Store on West 11th, Eugene, OregonManager Richard went out of his way to save the day for my 92 year old mother.  She had purchased a phone charger from the Valley River AT&T store the previous week and then they refused to let her return it because she had no receipt.  They claimed that they were unable to go back more than 72 hours to look up a previous purchase on their system.  I called the West 11th store and talked to Richard.  He first told me that the Valley River store should be able to find the receipt on their system and since she bought it there, it would be best to return it there.  But then Richard did some research on his own initiative, called my mother and said he found her receipt by going into the system.  He told my mother to come in to his store on West 11th and he would refund her money.  30 minutes later, all solved.  Richard then called me to say everything was taken care of.  Now That's Customer Service. WOW!My mother visited the Valley River Store multiple times to solve this problem and only received frustration and anger from the experience.  Richard solved everything in an hour from one phone call.If you want to do business with AT&T in Eugene - do it at the West 11th Store.  Avoid the Valley River experience.

So I was at the store on King Road 82nd Ave., Portland, OR there was a gentleman named Matt he is the manager at the store such excellent customer service he has provided for and myFamily you cannot find anywhere else I recommend each and everyone of you that are trying to get AT&T service to go see Matt King Road 82nd

I've been an att customer on and off for over a decade, and recently started a new plan. The techs that answer my phone calls are always helpful and knowledgeable, and extremely courteous. I had AT&T U-verse and DirecTV for several years. When I made my move to the new house AT&T has been nothing but frustrating and in responsive 2 anything they screwed up. First off my original install date that they emailed me turned out to be two weeks later which I was not notified. Then I give my old Gateway to the technician who installed my new U-verse Gateway and no note was made in the installation process and I'm still being charged for the old Gateway even though I turned it in to the technician several months ago. The new internet was removed from my account after 2 weeks. Calling customer service and speaking with the supervisor they were unresponsive and unable to turn my newly-installed internet back on so I turned in that Gateway and spoke about the old Gateway that I was given to the technician. The account has been in investigation for 5 months and now AT&T has turned me over to a collection agency who is demanding the money for the old Gateway that was turned in several months ago. I've had to call and talk to the customer service rep from AT&T every weekend 4 hours on end to try to resolve this and nothing has been done. When you move go with somebody else because AT&T is customer service reps and business as a whole is unresponsive and all they care about is collecting that cash from the consumer. I've never had an issue with DirecTV until AT&T purchase them and now nothing but problems.

They complicate their billing so much that you can't even keep track of whether they are actually charging you the right price. The remnants of hurricane Florence are heading my way. Probably get 20 mile per hour winds and they're already expect that AT&T will lose all connectivity for TV and internet. They suck
I would recommend anyone to try this company

I'm a little shocked about the other reviews. I signed up for AT&T's UVerse and Internet package six months ago because I desperately needed the internet in my new place (I work from home). Two months ago, my phone plan with Sprint was up, and I decided to go with AT&T this time around. I am not disappointed. When my first bill game, I was curious as to why I had pro-rated charges. I called the customer service center, and the guy who answered patiently went through all the charges with me. Not only did I get a clear understanding of my bill, but he dropped the pro-rated charges because I had not been informed of them. Best of all? Unlike with Sprint, I get service everywhere! I can finally have a conversation with my mom/sister/boyfriend while in my livingroom, in bed or even out in the country!

AT&T is an amazing company that has helped me reach my business goals, that would not be possible otherwise. Don't listen to these other people who are just crazy about T-Mobile, Verizon (etc). Go with a network to you can trust. "AT&T Rethink Possible"

I purchased a Samsung Galaxy 7 watch through T-mobile about 10 days ago. I love Samsung products because their support team will help you resolve and understand any issue. I called tech support and got CARTER B. who is probably the best customer service representative that I've ever dealt with in my life! At 70, that's saying lots! CARTER B. could hear my frustration, just as much as I thought he was stumped. The difference? I gave up, he didn't. He researched, and researched more, and after 2 hours said he'd call me back shortly, with an answer, and again reassured me it was all going to be fine. Through the hours he spent tirelessly on the phone with me, he never sounded angry, frustrated, sick of me whining, or anything other than supportive and dedicated. He would not let me go until I felt like I was confident in myself to understand my watch. He is amazing, patient, respectful, intelligent, kind and the best customer service representative ever! I've ran many huge corporations during my working career and I would've been honored to have him represent me/my company. I hope T-mobile realizes what a gem he is, because this young man is going to make any company where he works a success! High 5 CARTER B!!! Let's give CARTER B. the standing ovation he very much deserves!

Is it the best internet...NoIs it the fastest....NoBut I find it to be very reliable and fast enough for my needs.It's reasonably priced, has no data caps and you don't need a land line to get it. Which in an area prone to bad storms and downed lines is important.I'm also able to stream multiple televisions with no problems so I've been able to cut the cable and halve my internet and television bills. (I now use youtube tv instead of comcast)When I've had to call customer service, they've always been very helpful and diligent in solving any problems I have had. They've also been very open and admitted if the problem was on their side and not tried to blame me like some internet companies I know.So overall I give them 5 stars. They're just starting out as a home internet provider and I think they're doing a great job. Like anyone just starting out, they're not perfect. They are, however, determined to give you the best internet possible.

I must say that having Sprint acquired by T-Mobile has certainly made it difficult to get my phone serviced.  But, today, in Idaho Falls was an exception.  I was trying to send T-mobile my phone to get the screen repaired and the loaner phone that they sent to me just would not work despite spending two hours on the phone with their service people.  So, they directed me to a sprint/tmobile outlet in Idaho Falls in a shopping mall where I was lucky to encounter Emett. Emett used to be in the military until his eardrums were destroyed and he was returned to civilian life. Emett pointed out that T-mobile does not engage in repairs at their stores as Sprint did (bad change I must say), but he would do everything he could to try to get my loaner phone working.  And so as he ran between me and other customers he ultimately fixed my phone!  He was great and I'm sure would have been a Sprint superstar- too bad Sprint is disappearing.  But Emett did for me what Sprint would have done and I am so grateful!

Honestly, I am really surprised at the low scores of these consumers, because I cannot say enough about how well T-Mobile has really take care of me, specifically Phil ID#2196859.  In fact this man single handedly, made me have a complete different view of cellphone providers, that I have personally encountered in my 42 years. Most companies, are out to dupe their customers into hidden fees, excessive charges that were not there during sign up and once the get you in, you are trapped in the endless cycle of more and more fees and customer service calls. Well, this employee, Phil ID#2196859, single handedly change the game of cellphone customer service providers.I am a semi new customer, for me it is because I usually pick a company, and stick with them, as long as they are treating me like a valuable piece to a successful business.  This is any business, multi billion dollar business, to the local mom and pop business that has been open since the beginning of time. Customer service is the road for businesses to connect with their customers, customer service should be looked at as a reflection of how a businesses history is with their customers, but I want to say, that sometimes that reflection is fabricated.I had had issues with my phone, it's a new phone and I have already had to replace it three times, it's not a top tier cellphone but I don't mind all that, bells and whistles are not my thing. Function and Accessibility is all I care about. But I need my cellphone to work, I use my phone for work and this phone I got at sign up, crashes every two seconds, so my original complaint was only directed to the phone not my service. I actually had a semi hard time trying to trade my original phone back or have it replaced even though I had that specific phone for two days literally and not exactly two, it was more like 36 hours. But I requested to speak to a supervisor and she apologized for the inconvenience of the previous specialist behavior that his behavior was not what T-Mobile stands for.  She was very kind, and seemed to have fix everything, I had a new phone arriving, with a return label for the the broken one.I got my new bill, and not only was the charges that has previously been credited was back. She had not done what she had said she would do.  But I am a very fair person, I wasn't angry at all. I didn't know what had happened, it could have very well be within the system but it was my bottom line. My decision to call T-Mobile was ultimately to part ways or at least find out what I need to do to close my account, even if there was a charge.  But T-Mobile must have felt my vibe coming through the phone and sent in the he bug guns, because this is where Phil stepped in.I wanna also say, I am writing this review, on my experience with them, because of this particular person. Everything that is stated here is 100% truth, I find it unethical to write reviews that are fabricated for an incentive for that person or company. And I kind of feel like the sheer amount of bad reviews isn't and shouldn't reflect your decisions about T-Mobile, they make it extremely easy, and they also give some bad credit a chance without exuberant price fluctuations. T-Mobile in my opinion is highly underrated and I also believe majority of these reviews are baseless and not accurate.When I got Phil on the line it truly was a huge blessing for me and my family. As I have been dealing with these cellphones for a couple months and to be honest I don't have the energy.  My husband is in ICU and my brother just passed from Covid. And I don't think that I would be a customer if it weren't for Phil.  He was genuinely a very kind person, he should amazing customer service skills, had a clear understanding of his job, and executed a job with such professionalism, and care that I felt so grateful that I came directly here to make sure he gets recognized and If I could speak to his supervisor, I would say.. if you had about 3000 Phil's, within this company they would have five stars everywhere, the supervisor that did not do what she she promised, was no where near a professional as he was. And I honestly from the bottom of my heart, and a lifetime customer because of Phil. I cannot stress enough, him being a kind person was so important in this situation. nd he did just that and I can't tell you enough how he made my day turn completely around, I am truly grateful to this gentleman and if you are reading this Phil, thank you again!

I am new to T-mobile.  I am coming from verizon, the most awful copany in cell service I have ever dealt with.  I called them and could not get a person.  They force the chat option where robots answer questions and if you can get a human, they spew the same garbage.  I paid $70 and stayed one month.  I called T-mobile, got a person right away. Normal for new service.  I had to call customer service through 611 and got a person pretty quickly.  The first gal did not get my issue taken care of but since I found 2 more things I needed help with, I got someone who went beyound and called verizon to get my account number to port my number properly.  The call hung up immediately when the port was successful.  Took a little time but I got it done.  In fact, just a second ago I got a call verifying everything I needed taken care was taken care of.  Number  ported, got my netflix, and hotspot now works.  I got a hold of a person.  Verizon no longer answers their phones at the stores.  This even says so on thier answering machine on all 3 stores in Lincoln NE.  I went in and was told to open in a browser and figure it out.  I walked out.  Very disappointing experience.  I spent hours trying to sinc the ap and the phone and while their end said it was successful, I could not log in no matter how many magic numbers they sent me.  Nothing worked.  The phone will NOT work without the ap.  I had to enter in all information 17 times the first time and it kept erasing everything and putting me back to the beginning.  I only did it 6 times the second before I called T-mobile.  The ap is optional with T-mobile.  Maybe it is not all that good or maybe it is.  Either way I can chat from my laptop if I have the time or I can dial 611 and spend a couple minutes getting around their answering system to see if it is a quick fix or your issue is on their phone menu. The first rep tried and was really nice. She might be new.  The second rep spoke better English and that helps because I am hard of hearing.  The 3rd rep was in chat and she helped me with the rest of set up.  Then she called back to make sure I got everything I needed for my new service.  So far so good.  I rarely call a cell phone carrier so I hope to have many years of good service.  Way better than verizon in customer service.  I can't tell you anything about cell service because I was not able to use any other service other than call or text and a lot of the time they wanted me to connect to the internet and data did not work.  Very happy right now.

I want to leave a review so other people can see it. While the representative in the actual store failed me, the representatives in the call center in Tampa have gone above and beyond to help me. At one point I even had to speak to a supervisor, and he was able to fix the situation fairly quickly.I see a lot of negative feedback on this page, and I want others to know that if they are able to fix a situation that they absolutely do.A few weeks ago we took advantage of a promotion on the Galaxy S21 plus phones. They were buy one get one! The lady at the store told us that we could save money by switching are phone plans, and just getting a hotspot for the house... letting me lose a wonderful plan I was grandfathered into. The plan I was originally on is unlimited hotspot through my phone for $25 a month. Instead I was  talked into paying $55 for a hundred gigs a month... yeah that was not fair. Our bill ended up being well over what our original bill was, even before paying on the new device.The representative I spoke to on the phone did the best they could to fix what they could. However I still managed to have to talk to her supervisor, so that he could switch his back to our original plans.Flash Forward to today, I got my new bill update... $150 more than what my original bill is usually. So of course I was angry. I knew I would be paying more since I was paying on a device, and the fact that we have protection plans in place on both of our phones. But $150 was not the right amount...So again I called back, I wanted to speak to the supervisor I talk to you before just because he was familiar with my information prior. He was on another call at the time, so the representative I spoke to spoke it over with his supervisor, and was able to come up with a solution. He solved the problem and Save the Day!My situation was very confusing, it was even confusing for me to have to explain to them. But each representative and supervisor understood and fixed the issue.As I said, the girl inside of the store was terrible. She lied to us up front and cause a whole lot of issues... but thank God for those supervisors at the call center.
Ms. Lee and William were very helpful last week when i brought in my broken samsung galaxy 9 (completely, inexpensively fixed)

Am so grateful to tmobile chat team, Jerry & Hazel, you guys were so helpful when my phone was locked after traveling internationally & for 2 days I couldn't call or sms. Thro the chat you were able to help & connect me back. You were so patient thro the process. Thanks so much team.

I needed faster speed for my 5G phone.  I know performance is a matter of device/technology/coverage near my areaI had tried AT&T prepaid, Cricket, Visible, all on the largest/fastest/mostest-whatever unlimited service...My service speed and quality deteriorated with each in the order mentioned above!I decided to try T-Mobile prepaid...  On the speed, they delivered!  A sweet 200 Mbps in my area!Within the same week, I went back to my local T-Mobile store to switch from prepaid to postpaid, so I can explore and benefit from some of the additional perks on postpaid.  I activated 3 lines on postpaid Magenta Max.On the cost includes all fees and taxes, they delivered!On the speed on postpaid, they delivered!On the perks with the Tuesdays app...  I'm still waiting to find something that appeals me enough to go get it, but this is far from a dealbreaker!On the additional add-ons (included in Magenta Max), they delivered!  The SCAM Shield works good.  The DIGITIS app works good and with that, an additional phone number provided to preserve additional confidentiality when dialing out.  All that included in my Magenta Max monthly plan, in addition to unlimited text, talk and data!  On all this, they delivered!On service, over the phone, I wish I had written down the name of the person I spoke with to provide specific kudos to that person!  First, yes, service is over the phone, not self-service via a web page, you actually speak with a human!  She handled my questions and responded with clear information that was all accurate.  She ended the call by saying she was going on vacation but she would contact me once she had returned...  Me, based on all my previous customer service experience, I had forgot about this, assuming I would never get a call back...  But guess what?  Exactly on the day she had said to be back, the phone rings and there she was, following-up on my request!  I had a remaining question and she committed to address it herself directly, so I don't have to go through repeating my story again, and that she would call me back in about 3 days on this!  On customer service, not only they delivered but exceeded my expectations!From my local T-Mobile, I also received the same experience, very courteous, speedy and clear explanations.  On the locally provided service, T-Mobile delivered as well!I do not receive compensation for my review and I am not affiliated with T-Mobile in any ways.  I am just a happy customer!

This review on Store # 1645 at Metrocenter location;Let me start out by saying, I was a customer of Verizon for 21 years but Verizon  rates are outrageous for plans now. Coverage for wi fi in my area where I live in a mobile court is bad. Verizon unlimited was out of range as competitors & too many Surcharges added on to cost per month.I looked to TMobile & found exactly what I needed. Seniors  rates, unlimited  everything, could keep my old phone number & I needed to buy new phones anyway because ours were outdated.  TMobile has phones that are 50% off & some free phones depending on plan. For me, I am a senior, retired, on fixed income, needed to lower costs per month.TMobile has everything I needed, at best low rates per line, & bought found 2 phones. My husband only wanted standard new flip mobile phone but I wanted High Tech, 2020 model phone with all the best everything a phone could offer.I bought, Samsung A71 5G.I got it 50% off right now with Senior 55+ Essential  plan, unlimited everything 2 lines.$55 + taxes with Autopay. Per mo.I called the store first to find out if phones I wanted were in stock, a lady Sandra said she had them & would put them aside for us till I could come in.When I went to store Sandra was there, recalled who I was & had the phones waiting there for me. She helped me pick out best choices that would fit for my needs. TMobile has a lot of price ranges to choose  from with phones accessories but Sandra listened to me & helped me choose just what I had said I wanted in my budgeting range. Sandra also made all transfers from old phones to new ones, even keeping same phone numbers. She put all accessories I bought on phones, & let me pick from vary of colors & styles I was looking for.Sandra was excellent in her willingness to help me in anyway I needed. She set up all transfers of photos & contacts & apps, etc. that I asked her to do. She took her time,  wrote out all info I needed to do with me for use when I get home to follow up on. Her customer friendly behavior was by far,"Outstanding"!.I felt after I left store I had the best service for my money & felt like I was assured if I needed anything else from TMobile I would get  supportive quality services here.I am grateful for taking the move to TMobile.Thank you Sandra, & associate Ben, for your service.Sincerely,Sherrie &Dennis P

Greetings:1). I just recently sent in a complaint to T-Mobile about an outstanding matter. I kept good records and sent that in to their corporate offices on a Thursday May 17, 2018.2). On Friday, May 18, 2018 by  I received a reply to my complaint that a member of their executive support team would contact me right away.3). On Saturday May 19, 2018 I received a call from a member of their corporate executive team with an apology from corporate that they had looked into my issue and had seen that the information which I provided was in deed accurate. That they had alerted the collections company and told them to reverse any actions which may have taken against me; they also informed me that they had contacted the credit reporting agency to have if any  negative posted comment about my account removed immediately from their records as it relates to this issue.4).  The member of the corporate executive support team also informed me that if I should observed any further issues with this matter, that I should contact them as soon as possible and they would follow up on the issue.5). This came as a shock to me for I have been with T-Mobil for over 12 years and never rally expected any form of reply from them ‚Äì to just one customer in the thousands of users that they have? But this demonstrated to me and was told at the same time by the corporate executive support team person who had contacted me, that the  office of the President and CEO, takes their customers care and satisfaction very serious and that their first order of business..is their customers.6). So for those who may be experiencing issues with their account and have not been able to have  them settled, despite all the efforts you are making,  if you keep good and accurate records of the dates and times and the person you have spoken to and what the outcomes were on each call, when you would have reached the limit, send an email or letter to their corporate offices in Bellevue, WA. 98006, and send in a detail explanation, just the facts, and leave out any abusive or insulting words, and request an investigation into your outstanding case.7).  I am sure that when your complaint is received, they will respond to it without delay. It is to their advantage to keep their customers satisfied and if we can send to them issues that we experience, it well help them to provide training and perhaps even allow their technicians more access to prevent fewer complaints from  matters that could be handled at their own level.8). I have not been asked to make this comment by anyone. I am doing so on my on free will, with no promised of any kind of reward from T-Mobile.Kind Regards ‚Äì CK

She did not try to argue with me, she did not tell me that I was wrong...she simply listened to what my issue was and fixed it. If anyone has an issue, BELIEVE ME she would get it done. I have never wrote a review about a representative and she did so much for me I couldn't go without acknowledging her greatness. ASK FOR KRISTINA she gets the job DONE.

My daughter was in Japan unable to make a call or text, so I called customer service  at 10:30 pm. I was surprised they were able to contacted her in Japan they fixed her communication problem. I am very pleased with t mobile t√©cnical support!
Called customer care, and it only took about 30 seconds from when I dialed the number for the rep to pick up. The nicest rep and the best customer service I've ever had!

The only reason I am giving five stars is because of Byron from Albany. He saved me a lot of money when 6 other people I spoke to were not helpful at all. The only reason I stayed with the company is because of Byron from Albany or else I would have switched. Shoutout to Byron!!!

I switched from Sprint which are the worst with billing and customer service is poor. All I can say is the customer service for T-Mobile are awesome. I have had no problems dealing with them. No problems with calling either.
I was completely satisfied with the help I received. I walked in a bad mood cuz of other issues in my life but walked out very happy.cuz of customer service. Thank you guysüòâ

I was really upset with T-Mobile in 2017.  Previous review is below.  However, I waited for the next promotion, and took advantage of the BOGO offer.  Their service has been great, no connection issues, so I have change my rating.  The important thing to remember regarding my previous issue (below), is to alway get the name of the person you talked to.  Confirm things you are told over the phone with a supervisor, and the the supervisor's name.  This way, if you have a problem later, you can say who you spoke to and it will give your case credibility.I was so angy, I initially gave 1 star for T-Mobile due to below issue:Over the phone, I called T-Mobile to switch from AT&T to T-Mobile based on their good prices and the fact they were doing a BOGO promotion on the Note 8.  I was assured I could take advantage of the Note 8 promotion when I received the sim cards.   I specifically asked about this because I was concerned about the promotion ending before I get the sim cards.  The girl assured me that it would still be available to me when I get the sim cards.   So, a week later I get the sim cards and go into a T-Mobile corporate store to install the sim cards and port my numbers over.  I told them I wanted to take advantage of the Note 8 promotion as well.  They say the promotion ended 2 days ago, so nothing they can do.  I called T-Mobile and tried to fight this injustice, and no matter how high up I went in rank, the end result was there was nothing they can do for me.   So, basically, they got me to sign up over the phone (30 minutes) and run my social security number, spent 1 hour at the T-Mobile Store, and 1 Hour on the phone after I left the store.  All a waist of time.  I cancelled my service with them, and now I have to drive 20 minutes back to their store to drop off the sim cards to get refunded for those.  You would think they would do something.  It's just very wrong and unfair, and a waste of time.

I had the pleasure of working with a gentleman named Dakota (5116) in the technology help department. My phone had stopped working and would not go past the welcome screen. Dakota took his time and walked me through every little step, he made it extremely painless. I got on the phone in the worst mood and got off of the phone laughing with a fixed phone. Thank you Dakota for making my experience so easy and making my day do a complete 360!-Kelsey

I will have been with The Mobile for a year in July. It started out a little rough but I am completely happy with this company. ANY issue I have had they have fixed. If you want any thing fixed MAKE SURE YOU GET AN AMERICAN if you want to get someone that really understands you in English. I have had issues and gotten representatives that English is not their first language and they never fix the issues. I hang up on anyone that doesn't speak English well when I hear them and keep recalling until I get someone that does understand me. That is the only issue I've ever had with T Mobile. I don't care if I have to keep calling and hanging up until I get someone that understands me because it's worth it to me to get my issue(s) fixed. I love that on Tuesdays customers get cool deals and free stuff. They don't have to do it but they do and I pray they don't merge with Sprint because I HATED Sprint.As for now I have my bill directly taken out of my bank monthly and my bill has actually went down in price by 10 dollars since I started with TMobile. I love this company so much and I can't say it enough. All I have to say is if you have and issue, you haven't spoken with someone that speaks your language correctly or you have someone that is not having a good day. My suggestion is call someone else for customer service until you get your issue taken care of. I'm not joking, they will really work with you if you put in the time to find the right person to speak with. I have been an AT&T customer, a Cricket customer, a Sprint customer, and now a TMOBILE customer. I can tell you right now that Tmobile has done more for me then any  of the ones I have been with. I will be a TMOBILE customer for life if they keep doing what they are doing right now. As I've said I pray they don't merge with Sprint. Sprint customer service is THE WORST I've ever experienced and they gave me a lot of problems more than any company I've ever been with and Cricket a very close second. I have nothing but good things to say about Tmobile and I plan to stay with them as long as they keep thinking about their customers first as they do right now. If by chance they merge with Sprint, I pray TMOBILE makes Sprint conform to what we customers have with TMOBILE. As I've said Sprint is the worst company I've ever dealt with and I left them went to Cricket and then came to TMOBILE and I will stay with TMOBILE because to them it's all about the customers. It is NOT about the customers with the others. Again I want to say I love you TMobile!!! <3 <3 <3

I've been using the O2 SIM only deal at ¬£9.99 per month for a while now, and overall, my experience has been quite positive. Here's a breakdown of my experience:**Service Quality:** The service has been good. I haven't encountered any significant issues with connectivity or customer support. The process of getting the SIM and setting it up was smooth and hassle-free.**Network Performance:** The network works great. I get reliable coverage in most areas, including both urban and rural locations. Data speeds are consistent, and I haven't experienced any dropped calls or prolonged outages.**Value for Money:** At ¬£9.99 per month, this deal offers excellent value. It meets my needs without breaking the bank, and I feel I'm getting a good amount of data, texts, and minutes for the price.**Overall Experience:** So far, so good. I'm satisfied with the O2 SIM only deal and would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable, reliable mobile plan.In conclusion, if you're seeking a cost-effective and dependable SIM only deal, the O2 plan at ¬£9.99 per month is a solid choice.

HiI went into the Newark branch of 02 today. The gentleman I saw was very helpful. I had not been able to receive phone calls on my Samsung Flip for ages, no signal bars. I was considering of posting a bad review.I have been a customer of O2 for more than 5 years now and paying them every month around ¬£150 for my three contracts.I also pay for device insurance and although I went through three different contracts with them I never claimed for a damaged phone. Until today. Today, I called them to file for a claim for my water damaged phone, which flickered and shut down after being caught in a rain while cycling. There is condensation behind the cameras. The phone is paperweight now.They are going to charge me ¬£90 excess fee which corresponds to the 24 hours device replacement service, however, I will be on a waiting list until they will get that phone back in stock, that if they will ever get it back in stock. In fact, O2 and I are both apparently running on hope on this matter. So when I told the customer service that I need a phone for work the guys just said: "sorry, cant help you with that. Anything else?" Now, I am going to shop for a second hand device to use.Maybe it's just me. Maybe I did not read the o2 insurance fine print? Who knows?. I am sure that O2 would not have let their customers down and be dismissive just like that. Maybe it's my fault for expecting too much out of this phone service provider, and my fault for not choosing Apple Care instead.O2 is a great company. Sadly, I am not such a great customer. All I did so far was to pay my contract in time and expecting for services to just work.

The o2 at Ealing Broadway , Carlean is the best pearson to deal with any issue you have with your 02 account , she is knowledgeable, friendly and you really come out very happy with the service.I actually come all the way from Birmingham to see her .

Seen so many negative reviews of O2, so wanted to at least offer some light from my own personal experience. I know that 5G network is still a work in progress for areas like mine, but do find that I've linked up to a 5G signal quite regularly so can enjoy their speeds. When I moved to my previous house, I was with EE, where I had pretty bad signal, so eventually got to change over to O2 whose signal was spot on. Where I live now is abit of a black spot for other networks at times, but O2 signal is so reliable for me and apart from the odd maintenance work on the local mast, had no issues with connectivity. Every issue I have had, which is extremely infrequent to be honest has been resolved so quickly. I was recently overcharged on my bill due to my phone linking to a Turkish network whilst in Greece (also one of the only networks that still offer free EU roaming), they admitted that there was an error and was quick to resolve the issue and refund me the amount I had been overcharged. I genuinely can't say enough good words about their service.

I have been with O2 since I owned the iPhone 4S (the good ol' days). I am so shocked with O2's rating here.  It doesn't make sense!  I've been with them since they were BT, before it became BT Cellnet, before Cellnet and then O2.Over the many years with this company I have seen it develop a lot but the things that always keeps me with them are their customer service, their fairness and their reliability.So, how the hekk in hell are O2 only getting an average rating of less than 2*s?  I can only envisage two reasons for this.  The 1st is that many of the reviews are not from O2's customers.  I just can't believe so many genuine customers would think so lowly of them.  The other reason is that those rating O2 so lowly have never experienced the customer service of the other network providers.  EE already had terrible service and now they are now owned by BT I can just imagine how much further they will go to prove they are the worst.All people I know, except one, is on O2 and all have exactly the same experience as me.  If they have a problem, they call O2 and the call is ansered within seconds, not days like other companies.  Additionally, when you get to speak to somebody at O2, that person takes "responsibility" for your query, issue, complaint etc. and that person stays with you until all is resolved.  With other networks, it can take days of trying to get through as even when a call is answered it's only so they can put you on hold for as long as it takes before you lose patience and hang up.  When you do finally get through to sopmebody they either put you on hold until you go away or they pass you through to somebody else, who passes you to somebody else etc. etc. until you give up going around in circles with nobody taking responsibility for your query.So, with my decades of experience with O2, I really wish I could score them 5,000* so I can wipe out the fake and the unfair revues and leave enough to outweigh future fake and unfair reviews for quite some time.Sadly, I can't score more than the 5* so that is what I have given.  I highly recommend O2 and have done so for many years and not a single person that I have encouraged to switch to O2 has had any regret.

I recently bought a sim card for a dongle for use on a laptop by a friend who was in hospital. I had problems trying to monitor the usage (so I could top it up) so called o2 Customer Services for advice. The first advisor I spoke to was not all synpathetic or helpful as no matter how many times I told him that the person using the card did not have a mobile phone, he continued to tell me to advise him to register with o2 so they could send him a a text with a code...so in total frustration I decided to call again and was connected to a different adviser called Charlotte. I made it clear that I was very close to tears and might either scream or cry.... she remained calm and listened to what I was telling her very carefully - and straight away was able to get to the bottom of the problem. She advised me that I had purchased the wrong kind of sim needed for use on a laptop and advised me that after a while it would stop working. Rather than making me feel stupid she simply asked for the adress where she could send a replacement sim which I gave her. The very next day the sim card arrived at my friends parents house and they were able to take it to the hospital for him to use. Not only that but she preloaded the card with credit to replace the credit that I had put on th eoriginal sim card....  this was a just a really fantastic happy end to a frustrating situation in which everyone involved was already under a lot of stress. Charlotte seemed to understand not just thge technical issue that needed reolving - but also had great empathy regarding the dilemma I was in. My faith in customer services was renewed - if only everyone could be trained by Charlotte! She made my day - I just wish I could send her some chocolates or flowers .

Ok, well My Son had had a text message that said "thanks for subscribing to jamjar, ¬£4.50 will be debited from your account every fortnight" or something to that effect. My Son was confused and he said he had not subscribed to any one nor clicked on any links, hes a bright lad at university doing business studies and is very good with money and things like this so i knew he was telling the truth. i contacted o2 fraud team and the first person said we had to reply STOP to the number then ring a number that he gave me. My Son had deleted the text message knowing this was a scam and so we couldnt reply STOP to it, we tried the number and 3 loud beeps then dead, i though we had been told the wrong info from o2 so i rang again and what a great guy that sorted us, his name is Mohammed (Magic Mo) and he immediately refunded me the money, put a block on anymore coming through and also personally rang the company for me whilst i was on hold, sure enough i got text messages from o2 confirming all what he said. Not only did he help us he was really funny guy who made us both feel at ease and also made us smile, thanks MAGIC MO, you really are an inspiration to customer services. We need more like you. I really hope that this message gets back to him because these kind of people need to know they are doing a fantastic job. Thank you

When starting a new O2 contract it's best to block all Direct bills to mobile, Premium bar and International Bar to start, you can always remove the bars later by calling customer service. On new contract or upgrade from 1 October 2018 you can now set a Spend cap at ¬£0 to protect you from unexpected bills as you can always change this by calling customer service or MyO2 App. Most people on this form don't quite understand what a contract means. You are agreeing to pay them a monthly charge for 1 or 2 years plus any extras charges which you must pay on time. If you cannot guarantee you can afford it for the year(s) don't sign up use pay as you go no excuses please. Look after your phone and insure it, 2 years is a long time paying for something you have broken or had it stolen. I have used O2 (Cellnet), Vodafone, EE (One2One, T-Mobile & Orange), Tesco, Virgin and Three for over 32 years and I find now it's easier to buy my phone outright and look for the SIM only deals. It's so easy to change network with a PAC code and your number changes over the next working day and automatically cancels your existing contract.

Best service I've ever had from a mobile phone store. I'd been with EE for years, but found the staff in that store unhelpful and unwilling to fix anything unless it meant selling you something new; the OPPOSITE with O2. After not having any success with EE I went into their store on Chapel Street, Southport, and they were willing to help me without the hard sell. I didn't commit that day, but went back and since then have had amazing help from Anna, Ken and Jo, who are always so friendly and willing to go out of their way for you. Prices better than EE, their knowledge and expertise far exceeds the competition, there's never that awful wait time that makes you reluctant to even go into a mobile phone store for help, so overall, a complete winner for me! I purchased their own brand "1+" phone- was going to go for the S9 and really was looking for a great camera, but the 1+ was the winner. Am delighted with my phone!

Good Company with practical prices on iPhones which I was looking for will be returning for a new contract.I have just recently moved from EE and their greedy antics for new iPhones is just vulgar.¬£80+ for new iPhone and 3 gb of data what use is that to anyone when EE and most sites such you towards the internet they forget that when they offer overpriced contracts and dish out 3gb of data its obscene and they should be ashamed of themselves.O2 have been nothin but helpful 50gb of data, free calls, free texts best that EE.

I absolutely love o2 , they are amazing and have a really good customer service. I have been a customer with 02 for around 5 years.  I have had my issues as with any large organisation over the years. I shop at a number of O2 stores but I would like to mention the team at Galleria in Hatfield.  They are professional but relaxed and always smiling.  The even remembered us the last time we went in.Another fantastic improvement has been their online payment system.  This used to be the worst part of my month as Im not on DD and I have 3 bills to pay. They have improved the system so much and it makes my life a lot easier. I can see a large number of bad reviews on here for O2. However, set up a SIM only contract with them for my mum. Mobile Signal in her area is good too.I hope O2 try and address the bad experience that other reviews on here have had, it would be nice to think a company of that size would try.

I have been with O2 on and off for over 10years (off because I went abroad) and compared to other companies they have given me a good experience throughout this time. If I ever have a problem I actually like calling them (which is not the case with other companies) because firstly I can understand them (English spekaing people, no call centre in India), secondly they always help, explain well, waiting times are very short, when in the queue the music is nice (and does not make me fall asleep or burst my ears). Bills are well explained, easy to look up, same goes for checking your left over minutes, text, data from your plan. I love the perks of O2 priority, in fact have gotten many presents for my son for FREE this way (and he was a happy little boy) and love the ¬£1 lunch Mondays.Anyone looking for a hassle free, easy to deal with plan and company might want to check out O2. This is how it should be and this is why I went right back to them when I came back to the UK.A system that works, friendly and helpful customer service....thank you O2.

I've been with O2 for six years now, first as a Pay & Go customer and now currently as a Pay Monthly customer, and I've never encountered any major issues. It was totally worth spending the little bit extra to buy a phone from a reputable company.In terms of their customer service, whenever I have an issue or query, or simply need my number changed, I find the online chat service offered by O2 to be very good - with most matters sorted within minutes.The only issue I've had over the years is, since moving to my current address, I have never been able to take out a new contract directly with O2. Instead I have had to acquire a Pay Monthly contract with O2 through Carphone Warehouse, such was the case with my current contract. But I suspect that's more to do with the credit check company rather than with O2 itself.

Took 2 hours to up grade as the email service was playing up and couldn't confirm my contract and give me a link. Paid ¬£9.99 to have the phone delivered between 6.00pm and 10pm tonight. spoke to Tracy at o2 about my tariff and in no time at all she changed to something more suitable, no fuss, thank you Adrian Gardner

I have been an O2 pay monthly customer for almost 5 years. I decided to upgrade early for my birthday as I'm on the 'refresh' tariff. Paid the remaining ¬£100 balance for my old phone and ordered a Samsung S6.I ordered it to be delivered the next day before 10.30am.The phone arrived at 7.04am the next day, which was great because I do the school run from 8.30am-9am.Absolutely no issues with delivery or the actual phone which I have now owned for just under a week.I also called O2 to change my phone number which they managed to do quickly. The new number was active within the hour.I rarely have to contact o2 customer services, but when I do I feel that the staff always deal with me in a professional  manner.

I rang up trying to get my grandparents reconnected with their pay as you go sim as BT landline unavailable leaving them vulnerable.Straight through to payasyougo line (unlike other companies where you have to listen and press about 20 different buttons in order to speak to someone) then within 20 minutes my grandparents were up and running and connected again such a relief when they live so far away.Thank you O2

My name is Lucy and I popped into O2 store at frenchgate centre Doncaster to try and transfer all my files from old phone to new one. And had amazing service from a guy Steve. Helped with everything nothing was too much trouble. Also informed me of a better offer with 15% off my current sim only contract that I didn't know about so transferred to that. He sorted everything with my phone was so friendly polite. Very nice person. You have a really good staff member there.I have been with O2 for years and never had a problem with them ever xThanks very SteveLucy

I called O2 in order to receive a PAC code so that I could change networks (no faults with O2, just wanted to try a different one). When I rang the number through my land line, I was answered with an automated reply of 'the number you have called is receiving a large number of calls so service may be slow' followed by 'press 1,2 or 3 for various lines'. I continued to press the numbers to go through to the correct extension, and was prepared for a long wait and awful music. However, the phone started to ring immediately and was answered not even after the first ring. The man who answered was lovely and cheerful, he started going off the usual scripted questions on what he could do to help, followed by my reason for leaving O2. Although he mentioned if I would be interested in a cheaper tariff, he did not keep pushing or try to sell the company any further, and went on to ask me the security questions in order to get the PAC code. Then while he was typing and generating the code, he started chatting to me about his day and asking me about mine while I waited, before giving me the code when he got it. An absolutely lovely man, genuinely concerned and interested in helping me as the customer. The best over the phone service I've had; I'm having second thoughts of leaving O2! It was a wonderful start to the day (I rang in the morning), and although I may have been lucky in the service I received compared to other reviewers, I am left incredibly impressed with O2.

My mother was having problems with her phone and is quite Ill at the moment finds it hard to remember and can get quite confused, she was well looked after in store and given a glass of water. Nicola at Bangor store looked after her excellent. Thanks Nicola, phone is working great and on the best tariff for her thanks to you :). I wish that all shopping places had a Nicola to help!

Just renewed my contract after being offered a great deal upgrading (and I always shop around).. I have always found customer services with o2 one of the best. Never used a o2 store so can't comment on that as always been online or via phone but always found they've gone out of way to accommodate any queries or problems etc. Sorry the people in other reviews have had such an awful time and unneeded stress.
Just phoned 02 as usuall friendly helpful brilliant
o2 customer service help me  with  my phone problems

Ive been an O2 customer now for about 8 years.  Ive stuck with them due to the fact I can get a signal pretty much everywhere plus their UK based customer service has always been very good.I just upgraded and took out another 24m contract with O2, but had major problems with the courier company.  Not O2 fault.  However, O2 got involved, and stepped in to sort out the problem with the courier, keeping me informed all the way.  Their social media team in particular are excellent.After getting the phone I then popped into my local O2 shop to get a case and they did a great deal on one for me. Always been very impressed with this company and their aftersales.  Happy to be a customer of theirs for another 24 months.

Had an issue with the phone I had purchased via a deal through Amazon for the Amazon Fire Phone. Spoke to Amazon who refunded the phone once sent back, and spoke to O2 who were happy to move me over to a brand new phone (Samsung Galaxy S6) free of charge.

Spoke to 3 different people during swapping of my phone, one told me a cheaper deal from a different place, one told me to enjoy my sunday but called it funday, and one said 'I won't go home until i'm sure did has been done for you' Amazing people!

Received a call from Keiran at 19:45 on Tuesday 24th February, was very professional and informative, helped me out massively and has left one very happy customer, being a member of HR for a call centre myself I know the pressure agents are under but can safely say Keiran is one of the best I have dealt with.

I administer mobile accounts for our business and experience all networks on a regular basis, so would recommend O2 every time, as my considerable experience has shown them to be reliable and trustworthy, whilst offering some great little add-ons like TuGo, which has slashed our roaming costs.Vodafone are a big lumbering beast, whose decline in the mobile market is well earned.EE are very well polished and have slick marketing and an aggresive sales force, but after-care is terrible and actually getting customer services to deliver on their promises is like asking a politician for a straight answer.

I've been with O2 for the past 4 years now (having gone back to them after poor experiences with other companies) and they have been faultless in every respect. The level of customer service provided in particular at their call centre has always been nothing short of excellent. I have just attempted to purchase a new mobile/contract through Carphone Warehouse and another network provider due to the fact that they were offering it at a cheaper price than O2. Having had a problem with the online order, I called Carphone Warehouse, and I can honestly say I have never received such appalling customer service. I'm now ordering the new phone with O2, and will happily pay the extra for the phone and monthly contract, knowing that if I need support I can rely on  them to provide it in the same friendly and efficient manner I've come accustomed to. I had a lucky escape with Carphone Warehouse, and won't stray again!

Hellobeen with O2 for 7 years live in London area it's a great network always willing to help me and compensate me when they are in the wrong..I've been with all the other mobile networks and they all never ever had this much good customer service O2 the best ....they have great O2 apps as well plus SIM cards are for free unlike other mobile networks they charge u for a replacement so in my eyes 02 are great.....

I have just changed from EE to O2And the service has been excellent.Alan Gillespie has dealt quickly, competently and effectively with all issues relating to the transfer.The same is true for the rest of the 02 team. A far cry from the incompetent service at EE.

Had no signal for an hour now. This is a disgrace, how can a national network of complicated technology have a small temporary fault like this. Everything should be perfect all the time that's why I pay ¬£10 a month. This missed hour accounts for 0.1% of that 10 pounds; I hope management sees this and I get something free.
o2 are friendly and helpful, i have never had a problem with them or known anyone whom has!

A pain and stress free process of transferring from contract to pay as you go. They refunded me ¬£3 straight away for a mistake that I had made with not switching off mobile data on my phone, occurring ¬£5. I have never really had any problems, only minor which have been sorted out quickly.The website is clear and the online chat is quick and so much easier than speaking on the phone. They have a good selection of phones to choose from.
Good service but sometimes no coverage, no problem with your customer service only the network sucks sometimes.

I have been using O2 for over 7 years now. I have contracts for myself, wife and children with them. The customer service is always spot on. You actually speak to a person not just someone reading a script. The online chat advisors are all very competent and know their stuff. The deals are ok and when I haven't been happy (upgraded to a Nokia once which was s***) they swapped it, cancelled the contract I had taken out no quibble and I just started again with a different phone. Yes you will probably get more minutes on another provider, but I have used Orange and Vodafone in the past. I also worked for Vodafone for 4 years and I know the industry well. O2 are excellent at what they do. Plus their network is built on what used to be BT Cellnet as a result the call quality is excellent. I have a Vodafone as my work phone, in poor signal areas (I live in Devon so we have many of these) My O2 phone still has a reception long after Vodafone loses it's signal. Even on remote parts of Dartmoor!

Finding it extremely frustrating to replace my broken iPhone 5 charger, I contacted O2 to be advised which of their variety of chargers would be the best for me to purchase. I contacted their customer service via live chat due to my busy schedule. I was transferred to the correct department in seconds, and the second adviser provided a replacement charger free of charge. Fast, Convenient and very Satisfied customer!

I apologize for my previous review (negative). It was not O2s fault at all, but mine. First I gave a wrong number of my mobile requesting to unlatch. They wrote to me that number doesn't exist. Then I realized it was wrong indeed. Then I gave them a number, but I again realized few weeks later after reading the 'chat' record, that it was wrong too. Then I supplied the correct mobile number. Then they asked for its IMEI number, which they said can be found by dialing *#06# and I did that with my new phone without realizing that I should have dialed the above numbers using the old phone which I needed unlatching. So again I provided a wrong number. Later on I realized my mistakes and provided the correct details. Within minutes everything was sorted. I felt so ashamed and embarrassed. But the customer care persons on their 'chat' were all extremely polite all the time. It was completely my fault right from the beginning. So readers please disregard my previous comment. I apologize unreservedly to O2, and to you readers.

I realise that when writing a review you can only go  by your own experience.  Looking at the O2 score so far it appears to be some way from perfect but I have to say that in terms of the O2 Broadband service I received before changing a couple of months ago, it was excellent.  Rarely did I need to contact their Broadband helpdesk but whenever I did I found them to be very knowledgable and very very helpful.The only reason I moved is that O2 was being taken over by Sky.  I decided to move to Virgin - what a mistake that was!

I took my faulty pay as you go Nexus 4 back to O2 in Milton Keynes on the 1st November, as the bottom half of the screen wasn't registering any touch. They stated it could take up to 2 weeks to be repaired, but typically it's done in 4-5 working days.Queue Tuesday the 5th on November, the phone turned up at my door at 8am, just before I head off to work, working perfectly. Amazing turn around time, will definitely consider buying phones from them in the future.
Any time I have problems, they are available to help on webchat very quickly which saves me calling. I rate them 5 out of 5 for webchat. Thanks, Rach

i do hope I am not testing fate! I have been with Vodaphone (dreadful customer care) and Orange (service became worse and worse as prices went up and up), having had a mobile for 20 years. I have been with O2 for many years now, and am pleased with the level of service I've had over the period of time I've been with them. They are very helpful and have friendly customer service team! I have been on vodafone (absolute scam), 3 (bad customer service in general) & orange which have all been a nightmare. O2 are by far the best provider all round and i have been with them for 2 years, customer service is great, signal is better than most, they dont overcharge you ormess you about, i even signed up to pay an extra ¬£10 a month for an iphone5 just to be on o2 rather than any other network.At the end of the day, with sorting out issues you have to go direct to managers. Although it shouldnt have to be like it, if you get rudeness back from a representative, just hang up & redial and you will eventually find someone who will help you.Just remember, when you are feeling angry & frustrated with the service your given, thats when your more likely to write a review to express your frustration. The best way to find out what network is for you is to ask family and friends for their recommendations.

I've been a customer of o2 for quite some time, and I must say I'm impressed.To start with, I find that they have a nice reliable network. I can usually get a good signal about 90% of the time. The 10% is probably out of town, in rural areas. As for 3G, this has improved a lot in my area, which is due to more masts being installed by them. Again, 3G coverage is very patchy in rural areas.I've never had a call dropped, and have I probably only missed about 1% of any messages that I've been expecting.I guess their mobile data lets them down a little, but to be honest, I don't use it that much so I can't really rate them down for it. It would be better if it was cheaper, and had more of an allowance, but it seems to work reasonably well for me when I do ocassionally connect.Support has been great too. Whenever I've needed to contact them, It's always been a quick, and pleasant experience. They seem to know what they are doing, and get it done for you.What I love the most is the loyalty to their existing customers, along with the rewards for their new customers. They are always coming up with new and exciting schemes to reward it's members, all of which benefit me. If I left their network, I'd miss those.

It's just over 2 months since I switched to Vodafone broadband. They kept me informed prior to the change, on the day the Openreach engineer ( actually a subcontractor from Kelly Communications) was on time, he was polite and friendly, and the new service was up and running before he even left the house. Vodafone even phoned me the following day to check that everything was alright, I was impressed with that.Since then I have been enjoying faultless broadband with only the very occasional couple of seconds dropout, and a constant speed, currently 72.19 Mbps on Ookla (which shows slower speeds than other speed test sites). This is quite adequate for me and it is in fact faster then I got from BT / EE who were ripping me off for double Vodafone's monthly price. I am currently typing this on my laptop in the lounge, the router is upstairs in an office.My only niggle, and it is a very minor one, is that I don't receive any email notification when each month's payment is taken, I have to remember to log in to my online account to see them.

Recently upgraded from 100mbps full fibre broadband to 500mbps pro 2. Then found out shortcomings of 6ghz system that Vodafone Ultra router uses. Firstly 6e signal travels shorter distances and has trouble penetrating walls. Unless the router is near your devices or multiple boosters are used this will be a problem. Secondly not all devices can use anything above 5ghz so the supa dupa 6ghz will be a waste of money.Now my experince with Vodafone when I tried to change to 500mbps using my existing router. Vodafone TOBI chatline is useless. Even contacting a humanoid after 40 minutes he was still asking questions he asked in first five minutes. I gave up and phoned customer services. What a difference. Spoke to a lady called Meghan who immediately understood what I wanted and set  up new package with no prolems.Please note . With the pro 2 package Vodafone send out Apple 4k tv 3rd generation and a cat5 Lan cable. Both are obsolete.Netflix no longer supports Apple tv 3rd gen and cat 6 is recommended for home use5 star rating only due to the excellent customer service from Meghan and the good renewal price I got as an existing customer
